intro: [WRONG START] Equisetum giganteem var. caracasanum, commonly known as the giant horsetail, is a perennial plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, jointed stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant features whorled leaves that are often reduced to small, scale-like structures. It produces spore-bearing cones at the top of its stem, which are typically green or reddish in color. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
